meanings.definition: To make stronger or more resilient
meanings.sent1: She is fortifying her resolve to overcome the challenges ahead.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith is fortifying the metal to ensure it can withstand heavy blows.
meanings.sent3: The knight spent hours fortifying his armor, only to realize it was on backward.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a fortifying shield against the harsh criticism.
meanings.sent5: The image of her smiling face was a fortifying reminder of why he kept going.

meanings.sent1: The fortifying presence of her best friend gave her courage.
meanings.sent2: The fortifying walls of the castle protected the kingdom from invaders.
meanings.sent3: The fortifying aroma of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: His fortifying words were like a warm hug on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The fortifying belief in himself propelled him to new heights of success.

meanings.sent1: The fortifying tape held the broken pieces of the vase together.
meanings.sent2: The fortifying beams supported the weight of the entire structure.
meanings.sent3: The fortifying taste of the soup reminded him of his grandmother's cooking.
meanings.sent4: Her fortifying presence in the room calmed everyone's nerves.
meanings.sent5: The fortifying sound of the waves crashing on the shore brought peace to his mind.
